channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Certainty Is Overrated. Presence Is Underrated.
item.description: True leadership isn’t about having all the answers—it’s about creating stability when none exists.

item.title: Jared Kushner’s dream of a Gaza city full of new skyscrapers clashes with reality of 60 million tons of rubble
item.description: “In the Middle East, they build cities like this ... in three years," Kushner said in a presentation in Davos. “Stuff like this is very doable.”

item.title: Your Fully AI-Written Emails Are Making It Weird
item.description: Asking the new tech to draft routine correspondence is fine, but leaving it all to the bots could damage your company’s reputation.

item.title: 3 things to know about Trump’s ‘Golden Dome’ and Greenland’s role in nuclear defense

item.title: After 78 years as a founding member, U.S. fully withdraws from WHO—and it owes over $130 million to the UN agency
item.description: Nearly every country in the world is a member.

item.title: New York City sues reality TV producer Jordan McGraw, son of ‘Dr. Phil,’ trying to prevent negative police footage from leaking
item.description: “Intended to highlight the extraordinary work of the NYPD” the series, “Behind the Badge” at times portrayed the NYPD negatively, the lawsuit said.

item.title: How to Use the 3-3-3 Method to Get a Lot More Done and Feel a Lot Less Pressured
item.description: Feel like following a rigid schedule does your output more harm than good? Try this instead.
